title: 110_s2828
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Glacier National Park Commemorative Coin Act". Congress finds that President William Howard Taft signed a bill establishing Glacier National Park in 1910, which later joined with Waterton Lakes National Park to form the world's first Waterton-Glacier International Peace Park in 1932. Both parks are Biosphere Reserves and a World Heritage Site, showcasing their global significance. Glacier National Park's natural beauty has inspired generations to explore and appreciate nature. Glacier National Park, known as "The Crown of the Continent", is a national treasure with awe-inspiring beauty. The park will celebrate its 100th anniversary in 2010. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue up to 200,000 $1 coins to commemorate the 100th anniversary of Glacier National Park. The coins will weigh 26.73 grams, have a diameter of 1.500 inches, and contain 90% silver and 10% copper. They will be legal tender and considered numismatic items. The coins minted under this Act will depict Glacier National Park's natural features and wildlife. Each coin will bear a value designation, the year 2010, and inscriptions of "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum". The design will be chosen by the Secretary in consultation with relevant organizations and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS: Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities starting on January 1, 2010, and will cease minting after December 31, 2010.

SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS: The Secretary will sell coins at a price including face value, surcharge, and design costs. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will receive a reasonable discount.

SEC. 7. SURCHARGES: Surcharges will be applied to the coins issued under this Act. SEC. 7. SURCHARGES: Sales of coins minted under this Act will include a $10 surcharge per coin. The first $2,000,000 of surcharges will be paid to the Glacier National Park Fund of Whitefish, Montana for park support and infrastructure. The fund will be audited as per regulations.
